result.execSummary:
The defendant James Arthur Nickence was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence is withheld and DEF is placed on probation for 1 year.  Conditions of probation:  $579.00 fine/costs, NO CONTACT with Phyllis Belille.    Absolute Sobriety  No drug use without a valid prescription. 
Report to DOC today.

miscConds.notes: $379.00 fine.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$200 DNA surcharge.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Absolute Sobriety  No drug use without a valid prescription.

judgments.dispoDesc:
State moves to amend Ct #1 to straight disorderly conduct, removing the domestic abuse language.  Court approves.  DEF pleads No Contest, found Guilty.  Sentence is withheld and DEF is placed on probation for 1 year.  Conditions of probation:  $579.00 fine/costs, NO CONTACT with Phyllis Belille.    Absolute Sobriety  No drug use without a valid prescription. 
Report to DOC today.
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Arthur Nickence

Defendant James Arthur Nickence in court, in custody, with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moves to amend Ct #1 to straight disorderly conduct, removing the domestic abuse language.  Court approves.  DEF pleads No Contest, found Guilty.  Sentence is withheld and DEF is placed on probation for 1 year.  Conditions of probation:  $579.00 fine/costs, NO CONTACT with Phyllis Belille. Defendant James Arthur Nickence in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant James Arthur Nickence in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No abusive Contact with  - Phyliss Belille
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim "    " or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.
Scheduling conference on March 3, 2015 at 09:30 am.

A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.
